messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Lewis wants to help the sea. He wants more special places in the sea to be safe. Now, only 3 per cent of the sea is safe. He wants this to be 10 per cent.

This is because people damage the sea. They catch too many fish. They also make the water dirty and throw plastic in it. Lewis saw this damage with his own eyes on his trips.

He swam over coral reefs. Coral reefs are like gardens under the sea. Many small animals live there. The water is hotter now, so the coral reefs lost their color. They turned white. He also saw places under the sea with no life. They were like deserts with only plastic.

Lewis thinks nature can get better. But it needs space to do this. We do not have much time. If we do not take care of our seas, we will have a big problem. We will not be able to fix it.
